cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn WNW, then N across Florida’s Big Bend Thursday, emerge off the Georgia/South-Carolina coast Friday and accelerate northeastward well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Steinhatchee area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, Georgia and South Carolina coasts, Outer Banks, and adjacent Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Saturday with low (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible Saturday into early Sunday; totals generally <2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor tidal departures and increased wave action possible at the mouth of Chesapeake Bay, but impacts at Baltimore itself are minimal
